Ok people are crying so much about Akali's W, seriously chill out its not as bad as you think it is, for one it only last five seconds unless she steps out and back in to extended duration by a second or 2. Second if Akali just stands still in it you can see her location, Third her turret dives are not as good as Zed, vlads or Fizz, why? because those champs can basically ignore the turret vs Akali which is vulnerable to tower shots if she attacks. Please people just think about it really, there is counter play to this ability so relax.
https://i.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/001/028/246/dc7.gif

That's a gap in the logic I've seen in several boards post.

"OMG Akali can't be hit by turrets this is stupid!"

"She still can be, even if she re-stealths. As long as the projectile is in the air, it will still hit her"

"Yeah like thats gonna do anything, towers are useless"


....then why are you upset that the towers can't target her?

In an environment where towers were to ever become strong at deterring dives, as many players would like, such an ability would cheapen towerdiving by allowing Akali to limit the number of tower shots she would take. She may still take one tower shot, but she will nonetheless be able to drop this ability to evade further applications. In an League where dives are already often far too easy to pull off, having an ability like this only adds fuel to the fire.
And if towers became that strong, then other champions would *not* be able to make dives like that, giving Akali a defined niche that she could reliably make a tower dive kill.

I agree, a lot of people keep making the misconception of Akali being able to just ignore turrets all in all. It's really not the case, if you tower dive as an Akali, you're constantly using spells and autos which do indeed reveal you from the smoke making you vulnerable to turret aggro. All her stealth does is give her the agency for an escape. Assassins like Zed and Talon have been diving turrets for years while still being able to escape using their w and e respectively, Akali just makes it looks easier. 

It's funny how players overreact, they did the exact same thing with more unique abilities such as Ekko's ult and Kayn's E ("omg why can he walk through walls, riot wtf how is this balanced"), you guys can't label things OP just because you've never seen them in-game, it's good to see something new and fun added to the game, it won't be fun to play against, but that doesn't mean that Akali's breaking the game.
Trust me, zed and talon are considered cancerous for a reason.
... which is not a niche players seem to want to begin with. "Can tower dive more reliably" is not considered particularly fun when it's happening now, so why would it be then?
If we only did things that the boards liked, Assassins wouldn’t be a thing, CC heavy champions would be nerfed, champs like Yi or Yasuo would be walking gold sacks with no ability to do anything.

God beware we reduce the absurd amount of CC in this  game. 
it's fun and entertaining when you stand still as darius for 5 seconds because you get chain CC'd. 
You know some people would like to move their character.

And what about the people who like playing those CC heavy champions, like being able to lock down enemies and peel for their team? Do they just get screwed over, because some people don’t like a valid counter strategy to them?

Darius gets countered by CC. That’s his weakness. Sorry, we don’t remove that because Darius players don’t like being countered.
Almost all assassins have the niche to tower dive without being afraid of the turret. Actually, hardly a niche nowadays.
And he set up a situation where towers were much stronger, meaning that all those other champions *wouldn’t* be able to tower dive as easily.
